column5: Is anyone familiar with Bing inlet north of Parry sound? I will be up there in the near future and am wondering what to expect and plan for. Are there a lot of navigation hazards? Rocks, etc?
It's Georgian Bay, so yes.... expect rocks and lots of them.  I wouldn't be out there without hydrocharts unless you're going really slow.
If you stick to the river down to Clark Island everything (mostly is marked)boating channel. I'll be there from the 23rd to the 26 Musky Fishing
My buddy has a trailer up there and yes it can be difficult. Even with charts we had a couple dings during the tide going down. what are you fishing for? I can be of some assistance.  pm me if u want

Like Said from the highway to the mouth {clarks island) your good in the channel nothing to worry about..after she splits to North /South Georgian Bay that's a completely different story ..I live work and fish outta the inlet freeze out till freeze up ..Byngs a port its a shipping channel its well marked..the fishings been tough the past few weeks ..due to nasty change in weather no doubt ..skis aren't as active
I would be going after bass, walleye and panfish.
where are you staying ..River Haven? if you are the walleye should be turning on soon..both jigging and rapalas on surface at night

Byng is well marked in the river itself, the ice fishers like to set up right in the navigation channels in the winter as this is obviously the deepest part of the channel. The water is still relatively warm but as this weather continues to hold I imagine the pickerels will start making their way in.  As Bill said, dont even bother trying to navigate without charts unless you are looking to purchase a new boat soon.  Take err really slow and be aware that if you head out into the bay, the weather picks up quick and if you are in a small boat theres a very good chance that you could end up in 10 footers smashing directly onto the shoals that protect the area.  Bring Rain gear, if the forecast says theres a chance of rain, it will rain.
Ski's not active recently .... You got that right.   Been on the French 1 and 1/2 weeks ...... NOTHING.   Had some follows, but no takers

Ski's not active recently .... You got that right. Been on the French 1 and 1/2 weeks ...... NOTHING. Had some follows, but no takers Cuz they are waiting for me to get there to fish the new moon.(FINGERS CROSSED)

where are you staying ..River Haven? if you are the walleye should be turning on soon..both jigging and rapalas on surface at night we have rented a cottage directly across from the marina, or so it appears from maps

What others have said... get a map and or stay close to the marked channels. Once you have reached the open bay, you can either work left or right and get into some out of the wind spots... but any kind of west wind will make a mess of the river mouth. I found it a tough place to catch fish... but I was there in the heat of the summer a number of years ago, you may have better luck. Also, in the week we were there, I lost at least three days of fishing due to the wind. HH
we have rented a cottage directly across from the marina, or so it appears from maps Your not going next week are you ? I'm staying across from the marina as well
You guys are going to be roommates and don't even know about it!
your renting Haywards place..its across from the Marina yes..pan abode log cabin looking ..view facing east up river..fishing's tough ..both inland and on the Bay right now

your renting Haywards place..its across from the Marina yes..pan abode log cabin looking ..view facing east up river..fishing's tough ..both inland and on the Bay right now Why yes I am. Along with all my siblings and spouses. Two weekends from now.
Why yes I am. Along with all my siblings and spouses. Two weekends from now. You related to John and Ally?
No we just found their cottage on the web and rented it. Is is as nice as it looks on the computer?
its a very nice place ...its busy there all summer as well
its a very nice place ...its busy there all summer as well My first time staying there. Normally I've launched or stayed at River Haven.

your renting Haywards place..its across from the Marina yes..pan abode log cabin looking ..view facing east up river..fishing's tough ..both inland and on the Bay right now  dont be discouraged, the pike have been picking up!
